name: Avoid switch statement without a default case (Flex)
description: This QR reports artifacts with switch statements without default case.
output:
This QR reports artifacts with switch statements without default case. It provides following information:
- Artifact full name
rationale: Switch statements should have a default label in order to detect corner cases.
remediation: Add default case to every switch statement.

qualityStandards.name: Control Flow Transfer Control Element outside Switch Block
qualityStandards.description:
Objective
Avoid the unconditional transfer of control flow outside of switch structures

Consequence
Software that does not follow the principles of structured programming degrades comprehensibility

Measure Element
Number of instances where an unconditional transfer of control is located outside the branching based on the value of a storable element

qualityStandards.name: Missing Default Case in Switch Statement
qualityStandards.description: The code does not have a default case in a switch statement, which might lead to complex logical errors and resultant weaknesses.

qualityStandards.name: Poor Code Quality
qualityStandards.description: Code quality issues are fairly prevalent within most mobile code. The good news is that most code quality issues are fairly benign and result in bad programming practice. It is typically difficult to detect these types of issues through manual code review. Instead, attackers will use third-party tools that perform static analysis or perform fuzzing. These types of tools will typically identify memory leaks, buffer overflows, and other less severe issues that result in bad programming practice. Hackers with extreme low-level knowledge and expertise are able to effectively exploit these types of issues. The typical primary goal is to execute foreign code within the mobile code's address space.
